pageContext.description: Square mouth. Moulding below collar, with 3 pendant ribs wide apart.
pageContext.associations: Small hoard, probably comprising 3 similar socketed celts in Hull Museum and a Class V B Spear-head in Cambridge Antiq. Museum, + possibly 2 socketed celts in British Museum, and possibly 1 in Pitt Rivers Museum, Farnham.
pageContext.publications: Evans, Anc. Br. Imps., p. 118,H. found 1858-9, see also Mortimer, 40 years, p. xlviii, note: Arch. LXI 472 (Spear-head Class V B).
pageContext.collection: Ashmolean Museum, Oxford,Evans Collection, 1927-2665,H. S. Harland
pageContext.site: England,Yorkshire, E.R.,Middleton, near,On the Yorkshire Wolds,On a paper inside is written "Found near Middleton, Yorkshire Wolds in a gravel pit together with 3 or 4 celts and bronze spear-heads."
pageContext.toSearch: Middleton-on-the-wolds, Driffield, East Riding Of Yorkshire Yo25, UK
